title._content: Click! Panel Discussion at Figment June 28 11AM

description._content: If you live in the area, we've got a great panel discussion coming up this weekend at the Figment event on Governors Island. Panelists include James Surowiecki, New Yorker financial columnist and author of The Wisdom of Crowds; Jeff Howe, contributing editor of Wired magazine, who coined the term "crowdsourcing"; Eugenie Tsai, Brooklyn Museum's John and Barbara Vogelstein Curator of Contemporary Art; and me. We've got a lot more information on the details and how to get there on our website: tinyurl.com/4vkkgh Also, Lance has published a post on our blog detailing the upcoming gallery design for Click! along with some important details such as how many images will be displayed in the gallery: tinyurl.com/4fyhgn More in the next few days...watch the blog for updates: tinyurl.com/6blney Shelley PS- to all The Commons peeps who are new to us, we are talking about Click! A Crowd-Curated Exhibition which opens here on Friday!! More info here: www.brooklynmuseum.org/exhibitions/click/
